title: K9 mail integration
comment: Love it! Being able to send PGP encrypted signed mails is a great feature for mobile. The only reason people say the keys "aren't secure" is a limitation of mobile hardware. Supposedly the entropy collection on mobile devices is inferior to that of traditional hardware. If you're that concerned, generate the keys on your desktop and import them like I did. Also, storing keys on your phone is considered a security risk. Small request though. SHA512 signature support?

I seen that it has good integration with K9 email client, but I've done just fine using it with gmail on my phone with no problem. Importing secret keys is pretty straightforward and easy. No serious issues with this app so far.

title: GRATE Start
comment: 1st off I waited a few weeks to test it out before doing this write up  I found a few problems in the core of the setup of it,   when a user dos not send his key ID with the encrypted file it will not do a search for a good key (GPG and PGP do) I do not send Key ID with messages for safety reason and not all pgp messages I send are in stranded E-mail  when the key ID is not there it thinks it is a PW protected and dos not check for the keys.  (That should be fixed ASAP)  I also would like to see a way to do more advanced configurations like you can with most desk top client.   Both those things are big deals with me.   For that it is only a 3 star.  Removed one star for each problem I had.  Do not let that make you think this is not a good thing to use though.  I still do.  I need to know one thing not tested as of now but when certifying keys can you pick the certification of the key? and add notes to the cert?  (Both of those things I would like to see too if it is not there)   I do use a key policy URL so I would like to use it on the phone app too if possible.  Thanks for bringing GPG/pgp to our phones.

title: Bill L
comment:
There is a problem with keys that have certain attributes (I don't know whether the problem is with the Cipher attributes, the Digest attributes, the Compression attributes, or some combination of the three). 
 NOT handled correctly by APG: Cipher: AES256, AES192, AES, CAST5, 3DES Digest: SHA256, SHA1, SHA384, SHA512, SHA224 Compression: ZLIB, BZIP2, ZIP, Uncompressed     Handled correctly by APG: Cipher: AES, TWOFISH, CAST5, BLOWFISH, 3DES Digest: RIPEMD160, SHA1 Compression: BZIP2, ZLIB, ZIP, Uncompressed
I have verified this by creating TWO versions of my own public key, one for each of the two different sets of attributes shown above. By "not handled correctly", I mean that if there is a private key associated with the public key, and you import them, then try to edit them, you find many of the edit-key widgets greyed out; also, if it is a DSA/Elgamal key (like mine is), then the DSA signing key is not recognized as a signing key. Please verify my observations and, if correct, please consider fixing.
I'll try to look into that.

title: Easy to use, wonderful to have on Android!
comment: The one trick I found was that--assuming you already use GPG on your desktop machine--you have to get the mobile AGP to share your secret key.  I did this by copying ~/.gnupg/secring.gpg over to my Dropbox folder that I share with my mobile devices (tablet and phone), and simply allowing AGP to import it when I open it with mobile Dropbox.  Importing public keys from key servers also works like a charm, although the menu layout is slightly confusing to get there.  But ultimately, it imports fine, and I can now encrypt/decrypt/sign messages from my phone and tablet.  Optionally, using the K-9 Mail with AGP integration might be worthwhile.  However, using the GMail client and just communicating with AGP with the clipboard seems fine for occasional use.

title: A must have
comment: In the milieu of privacy breaching, this small gem is indispensable.

title: I don't like it.
comment: Because it's interface has stopped on Android 2.3, it looks like no longer updated. Also claims to know to open every file type, which is certainly bug.

Please try the new version.
Both issues have been addressed.

title: Works & Free
comment: Encrypts and decrypts email from K9 - thats what I wanted. Thanks

title: very simple to use
comment: This application makes it easy to communicate securely, I like how simple it is to import my keys from my desktop computer, it woks very well and it is also very customizable to my needs.

title: Simple and Effective
comment: Adds exactly the functionality I need. Could not have asked for anything more. Great work!

title: Great program
comment: Really needs some fiddling though, the associations with EVERYTHING makes it try to open things very often, this results is a crash and a slowdown, really needs to be adjusted.

title: Bad and Broken
comment: Bad keyring, file type implementation. Cannot even load in my private key. Do not use, seems abandoned
Please try the new version. The key import now supports more special cases. If the problem persists, then feel free to send me an example key that breaks it, I'll try to reproduce and fix it.

title: Great for K-9 Mail / BUG: registers for ALL MIME
comment: Works great with K-9 Mail Client but has a great "bug" or weird/unwanted "feature": as someone else mentioned it, APG registers itself to handle all MIME types on the phone so whenever I want to open pdf, excel, word file or movie it launches APG and APG crashes... So: 5 stars for integration with K-9 Mail Client but -4 stars for taking control over all MIME types. So result is only 1 star. PLEASE FIX THAT MIME BUG. Samsung Galaxy GT-I9300

It's not a bug, the idea was to be able to encrypt/decrypt anything.
However, the latest version doesn't do this anymore. So maybe it'll work better for you. If it does, then please adjust the rating. :)

title: Needs updates.
comment: Needs updates. Can't get it to import keys or work with external email app
Please try the new version. The key import is more flexible now.

title: Awesome!
comment: This app is great and is awesome w/ k9 mail. Only 1 bug: when I decrypt a message it bombs out, forcing me to reload, and then decrypt again (no p/w 2nd time required.) All in all a great app!

title: Crashes on text decrypt
comment: Have loved this app for a long time, but on my new Galaxy S4, I can encrypt text, but it crashes every time I press the "Decrypt Message" button, making it useless.

Please try the new version. Some of these issues should be fixed now.
If not, then it might be model specific and perhaps we can look into it.

title: A+
comment: Works flawlessly on SGS2.   Import key, encrypt, and create your own keys. BOSH. Simple.

title: Easy reliable
comment: Easy to understand pgp encryption, first app to be on my android

title: Old
comment: Not updated since 2010, many planned features still missing.
Please try the new version.

title: Great tool
comment: It rocks especially in compination with k-9 Mail app

title: Awesome
comment: For a free app that hasn't been updated in years, it works very well.

title: Nice concept, but...
comment: Now all of my files try to open in APG instead of the appropriate handlers. No, I do not want to open my zip file with you, thank you very much.

Please try the new version. That has been addressed.
The idea was that you might want to encrypt your zip file, mind.
Anyhow, it is now less eager to do so. :)

title: Works great
comment: Besides being handy for privacy, its spiffy for passing files through cloud services that aren't necessarily perfect at leaving files untouched in transit.

title: not working
comment: "No permission to read the account" when trying to add Gmail-account.

The Gmail feature was a hack and only worked on early Android versions. New Android doesn't allow hooking into the Gmail accounts like that. So APG can't do anything about that. The feature has since been removed. The best way is to use it with K-9. Please try the new version instead.

title: Nice work!
comment: Great app to have. Love the drive to enlarge the popularity of OpenPGP. Can use some 'tweaks'. Will use; offer my input & suggestions. Nice work!

title: Does exactly what it says
comment: Simple. Free. Fast.

title: Smooth
comment: Wish I could upload to key servers. K-9 integration is nice.

title: Perfect
comment: Thanks for implementing this into android, . Must be used with a good clipboard tho,

title: Sweet
comment: Work beautifully.

title: Works wonderfully
comment: Combined with K9-mail, I can send and receive fully encrypted e-mail on my phone!

title: Too bad there's no alternative
comment: Never got any secret key imported so it's pretty useless unless you change keys like your undies. Asked the author about out but got no reply. Considering the last version is over two years old it seems like someone has to take over development.

Someone else did take over development and I am active again as well.
Sorry about the lack of response.
Please try the new version, key import is more flexible now.

title: Fail on Nexus 4 / Android 4.2.1
comment: Private key import fails (Java IO error). Worked great on SGS with 4.0.1
Please try the new version, key import is more flexible now.
Just what expected

title: Example of simple, great app done right
comment: Works on every device, flawlessly so far for me. Reliable, fast, rock solid! Keep up the good work.

title: Soft needs update
comment: Can't import my keys (both in binary or ascii format, with either OI file manager or Astro). UI is also bugged.  In app keypair creation from scratch works though.
Please try the new version, key import is more flexible now.

title: Gmail doesn't
comment: When I ask it to integrate to Gmail on my Jelly Bean (4.1.1) Galaxy SIII, it says it doesn't have permission.  I don't see how to get it the permission.
Gmail integration was a hack that only worked on early Android versions and some devices still used it. It has been removed now.

title: Works seamlessly.
comment: Thank you. APG imported my keys and using apg and k9 mail is as simple as using gpgtools and enigmail on my laptop. I'm new to android and appreciate the ease of use.
How about Google Drive support?
Excellent

title: sym
comment: password-based encryption not supported...

title: Great App
comment: Works like charm while I don't need any integration to mail apps.

title: No updates for over a year
comment: Seems like a good implementation for Android, but I also see that the app hasn't been updated since Dec of 2010, even though more development was listed as scheduled on his website.   Kind of disturbing... Is this app abandoned?

Not sure whether "disturbing" is the right word. :) But sometimes life happens.
However, a very productive fork has developed it further and the new version builds heavily on that. Please try it.

title: Works, sometimes.
comment: Using it on JB with both a SGN and a Nexus 7 and it crashes often. Seems to have problems accessing AGP keys that were added after install.  Have to reinstall and set up accounts again.
Please try the new version.

title: Cool
comment: Awesome application, however I've faced a little glitch -- after moving APG to SD card it stops working until you move it back to the phone memory.

title: Fail.
comment: Would be awesome if I could both send and receive. Sending alone BC this program won't import secret keys is a deal breaker. What a disappointment I really wanted this to work.
Please try the new version. The key import now supports more special cases. If the problem persists, then feel free to send me an example key that breaks it, I'll try to reproduce and fix it.

title: Works great!
comment: Wonderful app but could use an update for newer phones with holo framework. The interface relies heavily on the menu button which new phones are getting rid of.
Must use text mode in K9

title: Could be good....
comment: But it has problems with integration and doing dumb things like dropping \n chars from messages so they end up garbled and unusable.

Please try the new version.
Some of the adjustments may still be done. But only for text that is signed only. Because a signature is very picky about spaces and line breaks, especially with Gmail, which changes some of them itself, resulting in a signature that isn't verified correctly.

title: Best
comment: Best android app ever. Hands down.

title: Recent problems
comment: Works great with email, encrypted files are not created, for some reason that capability is intermittent.
Please try the new version, those things should be fixed now.

title: Decent but minimal software
comment: The software is good considering its free but it lacks any support for 4096 bit keys either encrypting or decrypting.   Other than that its a decent piece of software even if the user interface is odd.

title: Keyserver support
comment: Claims to support keyservers. How come my keys arent uploaded there? I have to do it by hand on my Unix machine.  5 stars if this is fixed.

title: Cannot select key
comment: Hi, I recently ran into problem while tried to select key for encryption after my Google nexus updated to 4.1.1. The check mark won't show in check box no matter how many times I tap it. Sounds like a minor bug, can you fix it? Much appreciated.

title: Wouldn't be comfortable without it!
comment: When I got my first Android system, one of the first apps I wanted was a PGP utility. This app was the answer, and has been with me since the beginning.

title: Excellent
comment: Doesn't yet support PGP/MIME, but everything else works like a charm!

title: A must have application
comment: It's ridiculous that in today mobile e-mail life, a signature creation using openpgp standard still not included by default. An update or upgrade will make it perfect. Why stops? Is it involving government?

title: Perfect for K9-Mail...
comment: Works fine for me together with K9-Mail on Gingerbread and Icecreamsandwich.

title: Almost there...
comment: APG seems to be the closet option for GPG on Android. I was able to import my keys used in GPG. Using K9 with APG integration. Same issues as others like encrypted.asc attachments won't decrypt automatically, need blank line after PGP header, and so on. Good effort though. It's a shame it's not updated. Seems like the project has stalled.

title: Can't extract a keys fingerprint
comment: There seem to no way to get fingerprints out of it except by typing them by hand.

title: Limited
comment: Wouldn't decrypt a file that had both symmetric and public key crypto (from gpg --symmetric --encrypt --recipient foo). No way of decrypting to memory and viewing the result without saving to disk.

title: No longer works on ICS
comment: Asks for password but never asks for destination. Click decrypt and asks for password again.  Endless loop.  Worked fine on Honeycomb.
Please try the new version.

title: It encrypts. Half-baked.
comment: It encrypts and decrypts files as advertised. It would be nice if I can change the default location of decrypted files. Also, decrypting files directly to the clipboard would be a plus. The app is overly aggressive associating itself with other apps. It's functional  but needs to be polished to make it a great app.    -Droid Bionic
Please try the new version, some of those things have been addressed. I'll try to follow up on the others.

title: Outdated & Buggy on ICS
comment: Using AGP with Kaiten Mail (K10) app for PGP encrypted email, but setup was not very straight forward and AGP crashes often.  AGP works better with OI File Manager then Astro.  Encrypted files (acs) won't show up in Astro while within AGP.  Overall, it works if you don't mind jumping between 2-3 apps to read a single encrypted message.  Sending encrypted message is easier, it can be done entirely within K10.

title: does not allow gmail reading anymore
comment: app has not been updated since 2 years, and it's not working anymore with recent version of Android. See bug reports for more infos. Unfor this was the only tool to manage GPG encryption/decryption and gmail integration. Too bad
Please try the new version together with K-9. Gmail integration was a hack that only worked for early Android versions. It has now been removed.

title: Great app, albeit a bit unpolished
comment: I've got my passwords sync'd with Dropbox, and use this app in combination with the Dropbox app and Astro file manager to edit passwords on my Android phone. Sounds complicated, but it works well and is much more flexible (esp. on the desktop) than all-in-one solutions like 1Password.  The app itself is a bit rough around the edges visually, but it does a good job importing keys and decrypting/encrypting content.

title: Fantastic
comment: I only wish it could render decrypted mail properly

title: Works great
comment: Waiting for better GMail decrypting integration if it's possible.
Works well
Java IO error upon decryption
Please try the new version.

title: Perfect for SG2
comment: Work perfect, relatively easy to use. Supports keyserverexport/import.

title: Completely non-functional
comment: Key import and message decryption fail on both Atrix and Nexus S
Please try the new version, the key import is more flexible now.

title: Excellent app
comment: Good app. Does everything I want it to

title: Remove the greedy file assignments
comment: According to the author, this app can open everything. But of course it crashes when open a PDF or APK file with it. Pls. restrict it to common key and encrypted file extensions. Otherwise good.

title: Droid2/droid4
comment: Always worked perfectly for me, used with k9 emails and files.

title: I like the idea
comment: ... but can't get it to work. I know for sure the passphrase is correct. The other problem: it advertises to handle just about every intent, so it pollutes every inter-process communication.

title: Don't work with ICS
comment: It keeps force closing
Please try the new version, the key import is more flexible now.

title: Works as advertised despite labelled Beta
comment: Installed without trouble and imported both modern and legacy format PGP public and private keys without problem. As some of the legacy keys are circa 1991 they can cause grief with modern public key applications not used to historic workarounds to enable larger key sizes. APG coped well and I encountered no problems with encryption or decryption and signing. Keep up the good work!

title: Wow!
comment: If I only could trust the entire Android phone as much as I trust this app...

title: Old
comment: Hasn't been updated in years. It's so good that it doesn't need too.

title: Thank you, Thi!
comment: Your work on this app is excellent. I'm glad such an important tool is in capable hands.

title: Wonderful!
comment: Great integration with K9 Mail. Greatly eases the worry of Android email security. Five stars with no hesitation.

title: Fantastic
comment: I use it with k9 on my gs2.  I imported my public and private keys from gpg which I also use with Thunderbird on my Mac and PC.   Great work!

title: Encryption support for your email is awesome!
comment: A missing piece on mobile security, I'm sad to only have found it today.
Works great
Outstanding

title: Useful and Recommended
comment: Works great and integrates with K-9 for a seamless experience. You definitely want this if you use PGP for e-mail.

title: Ok,
comment: Not so easy to use, no integration with Thunderbird, and it only works with k9mail. Still, best free one there is, so I'm keeping it.

title: Great work
comment: Everything works on my S2. I couldn't figure out how to uploud a key to a key server.
Doesn't decrypt without adding a blank line after --BEGIN PGP-- Version x.x.x
Please try the new version.

title: One of my favorite apps on the market.
comment: Military grade PGP on your phone!? How cool is that!?

title: Some things work, other things don't
comment: I've tried APG on a Motorola Droid Bionic. It does encrypt and decrypt, but 1. Although it asks for the location where the resulting file should be stored and the default is the APG directory on the SD card, it always stores it in the same place, i.e., the folder APG in internal memory. This is only annoying. However, 2. Having decrypted a .doc file, modified it, and re-encrypted it, the new .doc.gpg file did not overwrite the old one, as the app claimed it would, but just vanished. This is serious.

title: K9Mail
comment: Worked good for signing mails with the above program so far.
Really great but can't decrypt files anymore :-(

title: Awesome & Simple
comment: Tanks to  dev.

title: Seems to work but can't import private keys
comment: Seems to work but can't import private keys so it fails for me. Acts like it imports key, but no key shows in list. - Android 3.2
Please try the new version together with K-9.

title: Won't decrypt
comment: Will not decrypt test message sent to/from K9. Will not decrypt within k9 nor pasted pgp msg blok in agp. Rsa 1024
Please try the new version.

title: A fix
comment: K9 mail seems to mess up the formatting, thus the decryption fails. To get it working go to Accounts > Sending > Formatting > Plain text. Vs. HTML
Want to use it to encrypt work emails and use google apps for email. At the moment I get an error trying to decrypt an email I sent myself.

title: Excellent, but registers handlers for everything
comment: This application seems to work very well, and I like that it fundamentally seems to be designed to be used by other applications to provide encryption services (of the gpg type). The only frustrations are that it becomes a handler for virtually everything, and that more apps don't use it. Of course, only the former is something the developer(s) can resolve =)
Seems to be in beta-stages at best. But, it does the job (most basic stuff) albiet, with an ugly UI.

title: Can't live without it
comment: And it seems to do the job.
Works well enough but the MIME type registration problem is annoying. Integration with K9 is ok too.
Best app ever. I love the fact that I can import keys to my phone!!! Hope it had better Gmail integration
What's the point of encrypting messages if it shows it in cleartext at the top?
Super awesome thanks!
Is good, with nits. New key creation allows empty password. Keyserver upload? Yet another app that always runs. Duh. MIME type reg totally dumb. Gawd.
Doesn't need background service running after you close app. This "service" drains battery.
Heavy battery drain for some reason. Had to uninstall from Samsung Epic.
Solid, stand-alone GPG/PGP solution. Wish list: Touchdown e-mail integration, 4096 bit key generation in app (supports 4096 bit imported keys tho)
I cannot sign or encrypt a message.

title: Liking it with K-9 on my Atrix
comment: No problems. Got my keys from my Mac and all's good.
Mimetypes

title: Works Well
comment: Working well so far on HTC Inpsire 4G, using it with K9 mail. Feature requests: S/MIME attachment support please, and signing of both unencrypted *and* encrypted mail would be wonderful. Better official GMail app integration would be nice too :-)
Please stop registering the app to open all mime types its useless and extremely annoying. Peevents opening apks for example. Otherwise its fine.
Very nice but doesnt do signatures and encrypted mail as attachment.
Drives me crazy. It seems to have registered itself to handle every MIME type on my phone. Pictures, music, videos, more. It wants to handle them all.
A must have, gmail integration should be better
No intuitive.
Seemed to work well at first, but now it claims to encrypt and save, but when I go look at the "encrypted" file its not there.
Love this program but wish updates would come more frequently
Great app, very well done so far. Works great with Gmail app, too. This is what I was looking for!
A good job done with tjue program.
Great job! Keep up the good work
Awesome! Pure awesome!
Thanks. Working 100%. Polish needed for 5*

title: Cool app
comment: Pretty good. How about the ability to transfer public keys via Bluetooth?
Indispensable. But looking forward to more integration features.
Can someone help this newb out with some instructions on how to use this. Thanks. Dell steak 7 / vibrant user.
working great in combination with K9 mail
That's why I've bought android...
Why does it keep a service running after closing? Great otherwise and open source!
APG and K9 were the deciding factors for buying an Androis 'phone. Also, I am very plaesed to see the passphrase cache time increased to 8hrs.Thanks
awesome
What method of file deletion is implemented when encrypting and choosing to delete the original?
Stable, amazingly excellent Galaxy tab.
There is no instruction or explanation on how to use or what this is for. Just found it weird.
So far so good. EVO 4G
Excellent encryption tool. Work well. Compatible 100% with Enigmail and Thunderbird.
Does the job very well, and integration with K9 is perfect.
Great app. Good integration with K9 Email app. ZTE Blade, Android 2.1
Quite happy with this app. Looking for more ways to use it.
Does what it says. Beats using ssh to do stuff on the home server. wish there was this easy of a solution for full phone encryption.
@Oliver: thx oversaw that at first. if apg wasn't open source, i wouldn't want to have it internet granted:)
Nice!
Reliable, fast and easy to use. Only misses search on key servers
Really rocks. With k-9 mail integration. Thanks !
Excellent.
Excellent! APG does every thing I need. Because it is Free Open Source, I can recommend it to the disadvantaged users that I support . Thank you!!
Now just needs PGP/Mime support
So far, quite excellent! Would like support for encrypt AND sign, and support for various keyservers and key revocation. What's there is excellent!
thanks a lot for this app!
Wonderful! Works flawlessly! 10 stars! Please work on key support or let it sync to keyservers. I had to connect to computer to copy keys to phones SD
Superb app. Only thing missing for me is keyserver support
Needs Move to SD Card
Has all the OpenPGP functionality you would need when mobile. Missing features: * download from public key server * force passphrase expire
Gmail support a bit flaky. Otherwise excellent and very useful! Would like Serpent file encryption algorithm, keyserver support & non-clearsign choice
Great app - and works a treat. Would install again :)
Works perfectly on my Epic, and seamlessly with k9.
Thank you for making this open source - I only really trust open source encryption. It works great with K9.
Amazing app I'm really looking forward to full integration with K9mail I'm running v1.0.8beta with keyserver support from their google-code page
awesome! im working on a project of my own and this will be very handy. thank you, great choice making it open source. expect a few patches from me :)
Needs to support accented characters, and opening Google account crashes it on cyanogenmod. Otherwise a welcome app!
Works great with my existing keys. Would love keyserver verification but the browser does the trick. Thanks!
Excellent app! Batch or folder encryption?
Loads better than the double ROT encryption I was using!
I'd like Sherri to find a better App. Thanks for all the hard work!
Manual public key exchange? What were they thinking? To put out such an incredible app and then to top it off with manual public key exchange was dumb
Good
Works for what I want it to do. Thanks!
Force closed every time I tried to use it on MotoDroid Froyo. Uninstalled.
PGP for android, finally!
Integrates well with K-9 mail. Key management features are great.
A fantastic implementation of pgp. Does everything I need.
Great if you have confidential files. It would be great if it could hook into all file access to auto-decrypt (once paraphrase entered).
Fandabby.
Brilliant! OpenPGP on Android, wanted this for a long time :)
It would be cool if their was a Dif name feature Ex: encryted a.zip but wanted it to look like b.mp3 while encrypted.
Constant force close. Good idea.
Works well enough, still limited to public key exchange and recipients. Try sslpost secure email, a lot easier and you can send to anyone.
Woo gpg for mobile!!
Good to see the integration with other file managers - i think it would be great if a whole folder could be encrypted in one go.
Great apps !
Great work, I love it!
Wanted to give 4 stars for no access to sd card but then support slapped me around my ears. Love that
Works great (htc desire). Feature wishes: keyserver import/export, key signing.
great program. excelent work. really waiting for some internet keyserver integration!!!
It works great on my HTC Legend. It does what it says. I just wanted something simple to encrypt/decrypt files, and now I have it! Thanks to the dev.
Crashes with encryption to clipboard using private messages. Bouncycastle seems to be running out of memory on cm g1.
Working perfectly, Android 1.6, xperia10. Gmail, files, messages, Importing keys... Thanks so much!!
Muy bien!
Amazing but could use nicer looking icon :)
This rocks
Works well. The update that let's you use any file manager was much appreciated!
Very well done.
Great program, developer released an update for my crashing within 2 hours of concern.
Great tool! Thanks for making it free!
Absolutely terrific!
When try to choose key says choose recipient and has empty list. Same for signature. Looks promising...but doesnt work for me on droid.
Thnx a lot, great integration
Good program fast easy to use
Needs better integration and support for gpg attachments. Quirky GUI but getting better.
Great app. Would like to see x.509 support also.
Everything is just there, the best app for my desire out there. I would give it 10 stars if possible. Everything just works as would expect.
Works great!
Great. Links to Gmail app pretty well.
I've been waiting for gpg on android sooooo long and it's finally here! Works like a charm. I would give you 6 stars and a hug if I could!
Cannot decrypt file after update.
Thanks a ton, app well worth paying for. Been trying to get the ability to to PGP since my treo 650. Finally can do it on my HTC Hero. Excellent job !
Great app
Needs a little improving but well on it's way to being a great app
Good app and getting better all the time. The developer is responsive and nice.
Crashes when attempting to encrypt anything larger than a few kb in size.
Good interface and features, however it is misleading because messages are not encrypted, they are merely signed by you. It does his well.
Need to support password cache and import accounts in Email, which supports corporate exchange.
Good app. Now if I could encrypt attachments add well it would be even better.
Works ok, decrypts fast. Email access is slow and flaky.
Imported keys, worked 1st time. Good job! But I want it to encrypt files too.
Thank you for bringing open pgp to android. I've been looking forward to this day for more than a year. Keep up the good work!
Works very well. I use gpg on Linux and gpg4win on windows and I was able to import my keys and be up and running on my Droid quickly.
Simple, but works well. Encrypting files would be a nice feature!
Great start, definitely works!
